title: Cisco employees by region 2010 to 2019
summary: This is a multi-line chart with 2 lines representing United States, and Rest of World. The y axis denotes Number of employees and the x axis denotes Year.
Overall Rest of World is gradually increasing, United States is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. United States, and lastly, 2. Rest of World.
Throughout the period, United States generally had the highest Number of employees relative to others with an average of 37327.4, and it reached its maximum at 2019 with a value of 39000.0.
The botommost line, Rest of World,  has a mean of 35351.4, and peaked at 2013.
Rest of World reported the lowest Number of employees about 30587.0 in Year 2012
The greatest difference of Number of employees between United States and Rest of World occurs at Year 2010 and the smallest difference occurs at 2013.

mid_summary: This is a multi-line chart with 2 lines representing United States, and Rest of World. The y axis denotes Number of employees and the x axis denotes Year.
Overall Rest of World is gradually increasing, United States is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Number of employees in descending order is: 1. United States, and lastly, 2. Rest of World.
Overall across the Year, United States mostly maintained the highest Number of employees when compared to others with a mean value of 37327.4, and it peaked at 2019.
The botommost line, Rest of World,  has a mean of 35351.4, and peaked at 2013.
max_summary: This is a multi-line chart with 2 lines representing United States, and Rest of World. The y axis denotes Number of employees and the x axis denotes Year.

The lines ordered according to average values of Number of employees in descending order is: 1. United States, and lastly, 2. Rest of World.

The minimum Number of employees about 30587.0, occured at 2012 by Rest of World.
